renderer

Class Renderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • renderer.Renderer

  • public class Renderer
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the Renderer class which helps render the game into the GUI.
    Author:
    James Del Puerto 300375073

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Renderer(Game game)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void draw()
      This draws the whole game by iterating through each tile in the game and drawing the tiles as well objects on top of those tiles.
      void drawObjects(Tile tile, PolygonBlock poly)
      Draws the objects on top of the the tile given and the position of object is determined by the position of the tile's PolygonBlock.
      void drawPlayer()
      Draws the player by adding the player image (in respect of the player's direction) into the root.
      void drawPolygonBlock(int row, int col)
      Draws the tile (PolygonBlock) for each tile and stores it in the tile's field.
      javafx.scene.image.ImageView getChallengeImage(AccessibleTile tile)
      Gets the ImageView of a Challenge of a given tile that has a challenge on top of it.
      javafx.scene.image.ImageView getImage(java.lang.String imageName)
      Takes in a image path which is used to create an Image which is then used to create an ImageView which contains the image of the object that is to be drawn in respect of the image path.
      javafx.scene.image.ImageView getItemImage(AccessibleTile tile)
      Gets the ImageView of an Item of a given tile that has an item on top of it.
      java.lang.String getObjectDirection(Direction direction)
      Gets the last suffix of an image path in respect of the direction given.
      javafx.scene.Group getRoot()
      Returns the root which contains all the images, shapes and polygons that will be drawn into the GUI.
      void newRoom()
      Clears the root and updates the currentRoom that the renderer will be rendering when the player has moved from one room to another.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Renderer

        public Renderer(Game game)
        This is the constructor which takes in the game parameter so it knows what to render.
        Parameters:
        game - the current game that is being played

    • Method Detail

      • getRoot

        public javafx.scene.Group getRoot()
        Returns the root which contains all the images, shapes and polygons that will be drawn into the GUI.
        Returns:
        A group of all images and polygons

      • drawPlayer

        public void drawPlayer()
        Draws the player by adding the player image (in respect of the player's direction) into the root. Method also determines the position of the image in the graphic pane.

      • draw

        public void draw()
        This draws the whole game by iterating through each tile in the game and drawing the tiles as well objects on top of those tiles.

      • drawPolygonBlock

        public void drawPolygonBlock(int row,
                             int col)
        Draws the tile (PolygonBlock) for each tile and stores it in the tile's field. Creates a PolygonBlock and adds it to the root as calling the drawObject() method.
        Parameters:
        row - The row position of the current tile that is to be populated with a PolygonBlock
        col - The col position of the current tile that is to be populated with a PolygonBlock

      • drawObjects

        public void drawObjects(Tile tile,
                        PolygonBlock poly)
        Draws the objects on top of the the tile given and the position of object is determined by the position of the tile's PolygonBlock.
        Parameters:
        tile - The tile that an object is to be drawn on top of
        poly - The tile's PolygonBlock

      • getItemImage

        public javafx.scene.image.ImageView getItemImage(AccessibleTile tile)
        Gets the ImageView of an Item of a given tile that has an item on top of it.
        Parameters:
        tile - The tile that has an item on top of it
        Returns:
        The ImageView of the image of the item on top of the tile

      • getChallengeImage

        public javafx.scene.image.ImageView getChallengeImage(AccessibleTile tile)
        Gets the ImageView of a Challenge of a given tile that has a challenge on top of it.
        Parameters:
        tile - The tile that has an item on top of it
        Returns:
        The ImageView of the image of the item on top of the tile

      • getObjectDirection

        public java.lang.String getObjectDirection(Direction direction)
        Gets the last suffix of an image path in respect of the direction given.
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction of the image it is facing.
        Returns:
        The last suffix (letters) of the image's path

      • getImage

        public javafx.scene.image.ImageView getImage(java.lang.String imageName)
        Takes in a image path which is used to create an Image which is then used to create an ImageView which contains the image of the object that is to be drawn in respect of the image path.
        Parameters:
        imageName - The image path of the image to be drawn
        Returns:
        The ImageView of the image to be drawn

      • newRoom

        public void newRoom()
        Clears the root and updates the currentRoom that the renderer will be rendering when the player has moved from one room to another. Draws the new room.
